item.title: Mastodon 3.2
item.description: The new Mastodon release brings you a much better audio player and improved support for different audio and video formats, as well as some additional security mechanisms.The audio player has been completely reworked to have a more eye-catching design. It will extract album art from the uploaded audio file automatically, or allow you to upload a thumbnail of your own choosing to be displayed in the center. Dominant colors from the artwork or thumbnail will then be used to give the player a unique look.

item.title: How it works - Briar
item.description: Briar is a messaging app designed for activists, journalists, and anyone else who needs a safe, easy and robust way to communicate. Unlike traditional messaging apps, Briar doesn’t rely on a central server - messages are synchronized directly between the users’ devices. If the internet’s down, Briar can sync via Bluetooth or Wi-Fi, keeping the information flowing in a crisis. If the internet’s up, Briar can sync via the Tor network, protecting users and their relationships from surveillance.

item.title: So I coded Plague Inc. for a Calculator
item.description:
Over the past four months, my friend Epsilon and I have been coding Plague Inc for our TI-84 Plus CE graphing calculators. Let’s see if we can get the creators of Plague Inc to see this!
Come hang out with us: https://discord.com/invite/3uYXCJy Follow me on Twitter: http://twitter.com/everydaycodenet
Download & Behind the Scenes: https://www.cemetech.net/forum/viewtopic.php?t=16753
Check out Epsilon’s projects: https://www.cemetech.net/downloads/users/epsilon5 https://github.com/epsilonfive
Support future content like this: https://www.patreon.com/everydaycode
Earn money by browsing the web: http://brave.com/eve137
Info for Nerds: This game was coded in C, not a very modern language for game design, but very much worth learning. The syntax allows you to carry over the skill to any language such as C# or C++ if you want to do gamedev, but its lack of add-ons makes it the perfect choice for low level hardware unlike Python.We did not have to rely on ANY game engines, but we used libraries made for the calculator.
I learned a lot from Tutorialspoint, but if you’re interested in seeing the actual source code for my C games, I post most of it on my website and my GitHub.
GitHub: https://github.com/EverydayCodeNet
Current Subscriber Count: 42
Thanks for watching!
#plagueinc #ti84 #devlog
item.author: (Everyday Code)

item.title: Python Beginner Projects 2020 - Add them to your resume!
item.description:
Learning Python? You should consider building some projects! They truly help you understand how all the snippets of code work together. However, you always see the same projects around and recruiters are not too excited to see always the same stuff. Be creative! In this video, I show you three projects examples that you can use to set yourself apart from the competition!
Corona Invaders: https://github.com/DavideMerlin/Corona_Invaders Election Scraper: https://github.com/DavideMerlin/Twitter_election_scraper Login Automation: https://github.com/DavideMerlin/Automated_login
TIMESTAMPS: 00:00 Intro 00:52 General Advice 1:29 Project 1: Corona Invader 2:55 Project 2: Election Scraper 4:31 Project 3: Login Automation 5:58 Conclusions
#Python #Projects
Social:
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/davidemerlin97
item.author: (Davide Merlin)

item.title: Create change within your locus of control
item.description: When you want to change policy, show, don’t tell. Start by creating the change within your local environment, demonstrating the benefits, and encouraging others to try it. Once you’ve proven out the playbook and earned enthusiastic support, then advocate for a formal policy change.

item.title: The Problem of Preference Falsification in Online Dating
item.description: Online dating is as old as the internet. It has exploded in popularity in recent years: roughly 40% of straight couples now meet online. It has given women more safety and choice as they participate in the dating market, and brought down divorce rates as people date more widely and make better-informed decisions than in the past.
